definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: He works on a state farm.
Protesters also seized the country's state-owned television station.
sentences.chinese: 抗议群众还占据了吉尔吉斯斯坦国营电视台。

sentences.english: State-run enterprises are often criticized as being inefficient.
sentences.chinese: 国营企业经常被批评没有效率。

sentences.english: The Premier announces that state-run petroleum company will raise gasoline prices from midnight.
sentences.chinese: 总理宣布，国营石油公司将从午夜起调涨汽油价格。

sentences.english: You are a state-owned corporation handling chemical products.
sentences.chinese: 你公司是经营化工产品的国营公司。

sentences.english: The state farm assigned the experimental plot to that group.
sentences.chinese: 国营农场把试验田划给这个小组负责。

sentences.english: We wish to introduce ourselves to you as a stateoperated corporation dealing exclusively in light industrial goods.
sentences.chinese: 我们是专营轻工产品的国营公司。

sentences.english: Wr are a state-operated corporation handling light industrial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们是经营轻工业产品的国营公司。

sentences.english: The paper also probes profitably the problem of vivifying the state enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 对如何搞活国营企业的问题作了有益的探讨。

sentences.english: The national carrier says it plans to reestablish routes to Europe next year.
sentences.chinese: 这家国营航空公司说，计划明年恢复飞欧洲的航线。

sentences.english: It is three years since I began to work on the state farm.
sentences.chinese: 我在国营农场工作已经三年了。

sentences.english: This is the new headquarters of a state-run drug maker in China.
sentences.chinese: 这是国营药物制造商在中国的新总部。

sentences.english: State-owned media Xinhua reported late-last year that the trend was rising.The U.
sentences.chinese: 国营媒体新华社去年底报道这一倾向正愈发明显。

sentences.english: It is a state-run enterprise set up in 1956.
sentences.chinese: 阳市酱油厂是1956年公私合营时组建的国营企业。

sentences.english: Its bones were found on a farm in north-eastern Australia's Queensland state.
sentences.chinese: 在东北部澳大利亚昆士兰州国营农场发现它的骨骼。

sentences.english: TVE will have to work fast to reinvent itself in response to the new guidelines.
sentences.chinese: 国营电视台必须尽快变革以应对新的方针。

definition: privately run (i.e. by a company, not the state)
public enterprise, as opposed to private enterprise 私營企業|私营企业[si1 ying2 qi3 ye4]
"cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 27), occurring in 原, 历, 压 etc
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
state monopoly of purchasing and marketing
